article.headline: San Jose State 53, Louisiana Tech 50
article.story: SAN JOSE, Calif. (AP) -- Jamon Hill had 15 points as San Jose State barely held off Louisiana Tech's late rally to record a 53-50 win Thursday night. Carlton Spencer added 13 points and eight rebounds as the Spartans (4-19, 3-9 Western Athletic Conference) saw an 11-point halftime lead evaporate late in the second half, and the Bulldogs (7-16, 5-6) took the lead with just 3:45 left in the game. But two free throws by Hill on San Jose State's next drive gave the lead back to the Spartans, and they held on to overcome a surging Louisiana Tech for just its fourth win of the season. It was the Spartans' first win against Bulldogs since Jan. 13, 2005, and just their third overall against their WAC rival since Louisiana Tech joined the conference in 2001. Chad McKenzie had 14 points and six rebounds for the Bulldogs, and Trey McDowell added 10. Louisiana Tech almost retook the lead when Harry Disy appeared to make a 3-pointer with 34.4 seconds left, but Disy's 3-pointer changed to a 2-pointer after referees reviewed video of the shot. Both the Bulldogs and Spartans endured long scoreless stretches in the first half. San Jose State shot just 33 percent from the floor, while Louisiana Tech managed just a 24 shooting percentage.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
